original: Åberg, Fredrik Emanuel, läroverksadjunkt, Vänersborg, f. 1/1/9S i Österåker, Södermani. 1., av kontr :prosten Edvard A. o. h. h., f. d’0’rchimont. G. 27 m. Svea Johansson. Barn : Birgitta f. 35, Monica 38. — Stud:ex. i Norrköp. 13i fil. mag. i Upps. 21, provår i Sthlm 26. E. o. ämneslär. v. Gästrikl. folkhögsk. 21-23’ i Lindesberg 23-24, vik. adj. i Gävle 24-25, i Åmål 25-26, vik. lektor v. Luleå folksk:sem. 27-28, vik. adj. v. norra latin i Sthlm 28-36, adj. i hist. m. samh :lära o. geogr. v. Vänersb. h. a. 1. sed. 36. Res. t. Tyskl., Österr. o. 11 al. 22, London 24, Rom (medl. av Sv. arkeol. inst.), Frankr. o. Tyskl. 27.
translated: Åberg, Fredrik Emanuel, secondary school teacher, Vänersborg, born January 1, 1895 in Österåker, Södermanland. First child of the deceased parish priest Edvard A. and his wife, former Miss D'0'rchi-mont. Married on May 27 to Svea Johansson. Children: Birgitta born in 1935, Monica in 1938. Completed high school in Norrköping in 1913, graduated with a Bachelor's degree in philosophy from Uppsala University in 1921, one year of practical training in Stockholm in 1926. Acting and subject teacher at Gästrikland Folk High School from 1921 to 1923, in Lindesberg from 1923 to 1924, substitute teacher in Gävle from 1924 to 1925, in Åmål from 1925 to 1926, substitute lecturer at Luleå People's School from 1927 to 1928, substitute teacher at Norra Latin in Stockholm from 1928 to 1936, teacher of history, social science, and geography at Vänersborg secondary school from 1936. Traveled to Germany, Austria, and Italy in 1922, to London in 1924, to Rome as a member of the Swedish Archaeological Institute in 1927, and to France and Germany in 1927.

workExperience.jobTitle: Teacher of History, Social Science, and Geography
